div.head: Names and Dates
div.p: This chapter describes a module which may be used for the encoding of names (names of persons or corporations/organizations) or descriptive phrases for styles, periods or geographical indications. ...

div.head: Overview of the namesdates Module
div.p: The module described in this chapter makes available the following components:

div.head: Elements
div.p: Basic Elements and Data Structures of the namesdates module:

div.head: corpName
div.p: Corporate names are non-personal names which refer to structured bodies of one or more persons that act as a single entity. Typical examples include associations, businesses, projects or institutions (e.g. 'the Royal College of Music' or 'the BBC'), but also racial or ethnic groupings or political factions where these are regarded as forming a single agency. Organization names typically include some type of indicator or pattern or words that help identify them as non-personal names.

Secondary name parts may be encoded in corpName sub-elements. CorpName elements as well as corpName sub-elements can be replanished with address-elements to note postal addresses of organizations within several addrLine-elements. To enable a localization of an organization, it is recommendable to use a controlled vocabulary for names of places and countries. The name of the list from which a controlled value is taken, such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names (TGN), may be recorded using the authority attribute. The web-accessible location of the controlled vocabulary from which the value is taken could be recorded using the authURI attribute. The dbkey attribute should be used to record a value which serves as a primary key in an external database.

div.head: geogName
div.p:
Geographical names are proper noun designations for places (e.g. Baltimore, Maryland), natural features (e.g. Black Forest) or political jurisdictions (e.g. Quartier Latin, Paris). Name sub-parts may be encoded in geogName sub-elements. The name of the list from which a controlled value is taken, such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names (TGN), may be recorded using the authority attribute. The web-accessible location of the controlled vocabulary from which the value is taken could be recorded using the authURI attribute. The dbkey attribute should be used to record a value which serves as a primary key in an external database. German Research Foundation

div.head: periodName
div.p: PeriodNames are names which describe a particular period of time, for example 'Baroque' or '3rd Style Period'.

div.head: persName
div.p: The element persName contains a propernoun or proper-noun phrase referring to an individual person. Personal names consist of forenames, surnames, honorifics, added names etc. It is recommended to record personal names by using a standard for personal names.

div.head: styleName
div.p: Music can be devided into many genres different ways. These classifications are often arbitrary and closely related styles often overlap. The label styleName describes a characteristic style of writing or performance, for example 'bebop' or 'rock-n-roll'. This element should not be confused with the periodName element.
